snippet: Two British authors adapt “The Hound of the Baskervilles,” Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s popular 1902 novel, expressly for laughs at the New Jersey Repertory Company.
abstract: Michael Sommers reviews play The Hound of the Baskervilles, comedic interpretation of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's tale by Steven Canny and John Nicholson, at the New Jersey Repertory Company; play is directed by Mark Shanahan and stars Rich Silverstein, Gary Marachek and Wynn Harmon (Metropolitan/New Jersey).
lead_paragraph: Two British authors adapt “The Hound of the Baskervilles,” Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s popular 1902 novel, expressly for laughs at the New Jersey Repertory Company.

headline.seo: A Review of ‘The Hound of the Baskervilles,’ at the New Jersey Repertory Company
headline.main: A Frisky ‘Hound’ Frolics on the Moor
headline.print_headline: A Frisky ‘Hound’ Frolics on the Moor
